com.google.publicalerts.cap.feed
Class CapFeedParser

java.lang.Object
  com.google.publicalerts.cap.feed.CapFeedParser

public class CapFeedParser
extends Object

Parses feeds of alerts, the entries in those feeds, and the CAP alerts in those entries.

public CapFeedParser(boolean validate)
Creates a new parser with no XML signature validation.

Parameters:
validate - true to validate the feed as it is parsed

CapFeedParser

public CapFeedParser(boolean validate,
                     XmlSignatureValidator validator)
Creates a new parser.

Parameters:
validate - true to validate the feed as it is parsed
validator - Used to validate XML signatures on alerts, if validate is true. If null, no signature validation is done.

parseFeed

public SyndFeed parseFeed(Reader reader)
                   throws FeedException,
                          CapFeedException,
                          IllegalArgumentException
Parses the given ATOM or RSS feed, provided as a Reader.

Parameters:
reader - reader for the given feed.
Returns:
the parsed Rome SyndFeed
Throws:
FeedException - if the XML could not be parsed
IllegalArgumentException - if XML could be parsed, but is not a feed type supported by Rome
CapFeedException - if validate is true and the feed is not valid

CapFeedException - if validate is true and the feed is not valid

parseFeed

public SyndFeed parseFeed(String feed)
                   throws FeedException,
                          CapFeedException,
                          IllegalArgumentException
Parses the given ATOM, RSS, or EDXL-DE feed, provided as a string. Unlike the stream versions, if validate is true, this version parses feeds twice in order to preserve line numbers when validating.

Parameters:
feed - the feed to parse
Returns:
the parsed Rome SyndFeed
Throws:
FeedException - if the feed could not be parsed
IllegalArgumentException - if XML could be parsed, but is not a feed type supported by Rome
CapFeedException - if validate is true and the feed is not valid

parseAlerts

public List<Alert> parseAlerts(SyndFeed feed)
                        throws CapException,
                               NotCapException
Parses the CAP alerts assumed to be in the <content> bodies of the entries of the given feed.

Parameters:
feed - the feed to process
Returns:
a list of CAP alerts
Throws:
CapException - if any of the alerts are invalid
NotCapException - if any of the <content> do not contain a CAP alert

parseAlert

public Alert parseAlert(SyndEntry entry)
                 throws CapException,
                        NotCapException
Parses the CAP alerts assumed to be in the <content> bodies of the entry.

Parameters:
entry - the entry to process
Returns:
a list of CAP alerts (one per content body, usually just 1)
Throws:
CapException - if any of the alerts are invalid
NotCapException - if any of the <content>s do not contain a CAP alert

parseAlert

public Alert parseAlert(SyndEntry entry,
                        List<CapException.Reason> parseErrors)
                 throws CapException,
                        NotCapException
Parses the CAP alerts assumed to be in the <content> bodies of the entry.

Parameters:
entry - the entry to process
parseErrors - a list to which to add any non-fatal errors during parsing
Returns:
a list of CAP alerts (one per content body, usually just 1)
Throws:
CapException - if the alert is unparseable as XML
NotCapException - if any of the <content>s do not contain a CAP alert

getCapUrl

public String getCapUrl(SyndEntry entry)
Returns the link in the entry that most likely points to the full version of CAP.

For RSS: If there is a non-empty link, it is returned, otherwise null

For Atom: If there is only one link in the entry, and it has no a type, it is assumed to be the CAP URL and is returned. If there are multiple links, the link with type "application/cap+xml" is returned. null is returned otherwise.

Parameters:
entry - the entry to extract a URL from
Returns:
the URL, or null if no suitable URL is found
